content: GO was prepared by a reported method, and the detailed synthesis procedure is as follows: 2 g of graphite powder, 1 g of NaNO3, and 46 mL of concentrated H2SO4 were mixed by stirring in a 250-mL beaker situated in an ice bath. Then, 6 g of KMnO4 was added slowly to the mixture. The mixtures were always kept below 20 °C. The ice bath then was removed and the temperature of the mixture was increased up to 35 °C and maintained for 45 min. Then, 100 mL of water was added slowly to the mixture. After that, 100 mL of 3% H2O2 was added to the reaction mixture and further stirred for ∼30 min at 80 °C. Finally, a brownish product was washed with 1 M HCl and deionized water, filtered, and dried.
clean_text: GO was prepared by a reported method, and the detailed synthesis procedure is as follows: 2 g of graphite powder, 1 g of NaNO3, and 46 mL of concentrated H2SO4 were mixed by stirring in a 250-mL beaker situated in an ice bath. Then, 6 g of KMnO4 was added slowly to the mixture. The mixtures were always kept below 20 °C. The ice bath then was removed and the temperature of the mixture was increased up to 35 °C and maintained for 45 min. Then, 100 mL of water was added slowly to the mixture. After that, 100 mL of 3% H2O2 was added to the reaction mixture and further stirred for ~30 min at 80 °C. Finally, a brownish product was washed with 1 M HCl and deionized water, filtered, and dried.
